intro: Borreria vaginata, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Mexican mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. It is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Borreria vaginata is known for its adaptability and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
